Luisa Lucie-Smith

Ciao! I am a Research Fellow at the Max Planck Institute for Astrophysics in Garching, working in the fields of cosmology and artificial intelligence. My research focuses on learning about the formation of structures in the Universe using machine learning.

I am currently a Research Fellow at the Max Planck Institute for Astrophysics (MPA) in Garching, Germany.

Previously, I took a one-year postdoctoral research position University College London (UCL), working in the GMGalaxies research group led by Andrew Pontzen, where I also did my PhD under the supervision of Prof. Hiranya Peiris and Prof. Andrew Pontzen.

You can find a more formal description of my background in my CV and a list of my papers on arXiv.
